author: Justin Soderberg
title: UMass Lowell Alumni Report: October 2015
text:
Tweet on Twitter 
The UMass Lowell River Hawks have 29 former student athletes playing professional hockey across the globe this season. The Alumni Report takes a look at all their statistics and tracks their season. 
In the first issue of the 2015-16 season, Riley Wetmore (Dundee Stars, EIHL), Michael Budd (ESC Wedemark Scorpions, GER3), and Scott Campbell (SønderjyskE, DEN) lead the way in the scoring category. Carter Hutton (Nashville Predators, NHL) has only a single game under his belt, but leads the list of goaltenders in the save percentage category. 
Scott Wilson (WBS Penguins, AHL) has started his 2015-16 season off hot and leads all former River Hawks in scoring in North America. 
The report also includes statistics (up to October 20, 2015) and transaction details for all former River Hawks. 
View the latest issue online above or download a PDF below! 
You can also pick up a copy of this month’s Alumni Report at the next River Hawk hockey game at the Tsongas Center . They will be available, for free, at the information table. 
2014-15 issues: October | November | December | January | February | March | April For more archived issues visit: millcitysports.com/alumnireport The UMass Lowell Alumni Report is produced by MILL CITY SPORTS with research help by Lowell alum and longtime season ticket holder Scott Kaplan. This report is NOT an official University publication, nor is it affiliated with any professional hockey league mentioned in the report. Questions? contact@millcitysports.com LAST ALUMNI REPORT
